ResearchCalc.title: Research Calc for Pokémon Sleep
ResearchCalc.description: Using this tool is easy! Simply enter your Research Area and Snorlax strength. You can know how many Pokémon will appear for each sleep score.
ResearchCalc.notice detail1: While Good Sleep Day, don't forget to change the multiplier for the [$t(bonus)]!
ResearchCalc.notice detail2: If you check [$t(sleep twice)], you can know the total number of Pokémon.

IvCalc.title: IV Calc for Pokémon Sleep
IvCalc.description: Using this tool is easy! Simply enter your pokemon, level and skill. You will know its individual values such as RP and strength.
IvCalc.notice detail1: Let's check the future RP and Strength of the Pokémon.

v2.10.0.headline: Balance adjustments in v2.10.0 have been reflected in the Candy Calculator feature.
v2.10.0.detail: In the Candy Calculator feature, the candy usage for Pokémon below level 30 has been reduced.

add farfetch'd.headline: Farfetch'd has been added.
add farfetch'd.detail: The ingredient% and skill% are based on RP Collection values.

add mawile & candy calc.headline: Mawile has been added. A candy calculator feature has also been added.
add mawile & candy calc.detail:
The ingredient% and skill% are based on RP Collection values.
A candy calculator feature can be used by tapping the candy button to the right of the Pokémon’s name, or by selecting [Candy] from the ︙ menu at the top right of a Pokémon in your box.

v2.9.0.headline: Updated the data for Pokémon with balance adjustments in v2.9.0.
v2.9.0.detail: Frequency of Butterfree, Dodrio, and Altaria has been updated.

add murkrow.headline: Murkrow and Honchkrow has been added.
add murkrow.detail: The ingredient% and skill% are based on RP Collection values.

darkrai ing.headline: It is now possible to change Darkrai's ingredients.
darkrai ing.detail: The count of the third ingredient is an estimate and may not be accurate.

add happiny.headline: Happiny, Chansey and Blissey has been added.
add happiny.detail: The ingredient% and skill% are based on RP Collection values.

v2.7.0.headline: Support for version 2.7.0 has been added.
v2.7.0.detail: Added support for RP calculation up to level 65, as well as skill level cap unlocks.

add darkrai.headline: Darkrai has been added!!!
add darkrai.detail: The ingredient% and skill% are based on RP Collection values.

add cresselia.headline: Cresselia has been added!!!
add cresselia.detail: The ingredient% and skill% are based on RP Collection values.

v2.6.0.headline: Balance adjustments in v2.6.0 have been applied.
v2.6.0.detail: Speed of Help ▼▼ modifiers has been changed from 1.1 to 1.075.

add munna.headline: Munna and Musharna are added!!!
add munna.detail: The ingredient% and skill% are based on RP Collection values.

add clodsire.headline: Wooper (Paldea) and Clodsire are added!!!
add clodsire.detail: The ingredient% and skill% are based on RP Collection values.

v2.5.0.headline: Updated the data for Absol with balance adjustments in v2.5.0.

add rufflet.headline: Rufflet and Braviary are added!!!
add rufflet.detail: The ingredient% and skill% are based on RP Collection values.

v2.4.0.headline: Updated the data for Pokémon with balance adjustments in v2.4.0.
v2.4.0.detail: The ingredient% and skill% are based on RP Collection values.

add holiday 2024 pokemons.headline: New Pokémon data for the holiday event has been added.
add holiday 2024 pokemons.detail: The ingredient% and skill% are based on RP Collection values.

v2.3.0.headline: Updated the data for Pokémon with balance adjustments in v2.3.0.
v2.3.0.detail: The ingredient% and skill% are based on RP Collection values.

holiday 2024.headline: You can now simulate Holiday event.
holiday 2024.detail: You can now check the performance of Pokémon during the Holiday event in the [$t(strength2)] tab.

add sneasel.headline: Sneasel and Weavile are added!!!
add sneasel.detail: The ingredient% and skill% are based on RP Collection values.

eevee week 2024.headline: You can now simulate Eevee week.
eevee week 2024.detail: You can now check the skill performance of Pokémon during the Eevee week in the [$t(strength2)] tab.

add mimikyu.headline: Mimikyu is added!!!
add mimikyu.detail: The ingredient% and skill% are based on RP Collection values.

v2.1.0.headline: Updated the data for Houndour, Houndoom, Umbreon, and Pikachu (Halloween).
v2.1.0.detail: The ingredient% and skill% are based on RP Collection values.

halloween event 2024 simmulation.headline: You can now simulate Halloween event.
halloween event 2024 simmulation.detail: You can now check the performance of Ghost-type Pokémon during the Halloween event in the [$t(strength2)] tab.

add drifloon and drifblim.headline: Drifloon and Drifblim are added!!!
add drifloon and drifblim.detail:
The ingredient% and skill% are based on RP Collection values.
The strength amount is calculated based on the assumption that it spits up every time.

add OGPP pokemons.headline: Grubbin, Shinx, Aron, and their evolutions are added!!!
add OGPP pokemons.detail: The ingredient% and skill% are based on RP Collection values.

add OGPP.headline: Old Gold Power Plant has been added to research area list.
add OGPP.detail: You can now easily simulate your pokemon's strength at Old Gold Power Plant.

add suicune.headline: Suicune are added!!!
add suicune.detail: The ingredient% and skill% are based on RP Collection values.

add wooper and quagsire.headline: Wooper and Quagsire are added!!!
add wooper and quagsire.detail: The ingredient% and skill% are based on RP Collection values.

box filter and sort improvement.headline: Box filtering and sorting have significantly evolved.
box filter and sort improvement.detail:
You can now filter the box by Spiecies Name, Nickname, $t(ingredient), $t(main skill), and $t(sub skills).
Additionally, sorting options have been expanded to include $t(berry), $t(ingredient), and $t(skill count).

suicune event simmulation.headline: You can now simulate Suicune event.
suicune event simmulation.detail: You can now check the performance of Water-type Pokémon during the Suicune event in the [$t(strength2)] tab.

evolution count and ribbon.headline: The evolution count and the level of Good-Night Ribbon are now configurable.
evolution count and ribbon.detail:
You can now specify the evolution count with [$t(carry limit)] and the sleeping time with [$t(sleeping time shared)].
This allows you to check Pokémon performance with appropriate values for '$t(carry limit)' and '$t(frequency)'.

bank main skill.headline: The probability of the main skill being banked is now available.
bank main skill.detail:
In the [Energy] tab, you can now see the probability of the main skill being banked in the [Wake up skill] section (only Pokémon with the Skills specialty). This number is also reflected in the calculation of skill occurrences.
Additionally, a new setting item, [Tap frequency (Asleep)], has been added. You can now check the abilities when sneaky snacking does not occur during the night.

add paldea starter.headline: Sprigatito, Fuecoco, Quaxly, and their evolutions are added!!!
add paldea starter.detail: The ingredient% and skill% are based on RP Collection values.

v1.9.0.headline: Energy efficiency values adjusted in response to changes made by Pokémon Sleep version 1.9.0.
v1.9.0.detail:
We have responded to the change implemented in Pokémon Sleep 1.9.0, where 'Help from helper Pokémon with low Energy will be slightly more effective.' (ref: ポケモンスリープ攻略・検証Wiki, Pokémon Sleep Info Wiki)
We have also increased box capacity from 100 to 150.

energy nature and inventory.headline: Carry limit and energy recovery nature are now taken into account when calculating strength.
energy nature and inventory.detail:
Previously, we have overestimated the abilities of Pokémon whose inventory overflows at night, but we are now approaching the actual number of ingredients and skill occurrences. Additionally, in the [STRENGTH] tab, you can now check the time until full inventory during sleep and the wake up skill%.
Currently, the carry limit is estimated under the assumption that the Pokémon is caught in its pre-evolved state.

translation.custom icon summary: You can change the Pokémon icon.
translation.custom icon details: Use @ID1@ to @ID4@ in the URL to specify the Pokédex number. For example, @ID3@.png will be replaced with 001.png when the Pokédex number is 1.
translation.custom icon invalid message: The URL for the custom icon is not valid. Please leave it blank or set the correct value.
translation.strength too low: Snorlax strength should be at least <strength/>.
translation.next strength to get 1 more pokemon: If you gain <strength2/> strength by the second sleep, you will encounter <count2/> Pokémon during the second sleep session (Only when the first sleep score is <score1/>).
translation.border is not fixed: The drowsy power required for the specified number of Pokémon to appear is still under investigation. The specified number of Pokémon might appear with scores or energy lower than the shown values.
translation.pwa notice: Add '{{app}}' to your home screen for fast access.
translation.how to add to home screen: How to Add to Home Screen
translation.push share icon: Press <share/> located at the bottom of the Safari. (If you cannot find the icon, close this popup and scroll upward)
translation.select add to home screen: Select [Add to Home Screen <add/>] from the menu.
translation.go to strength tab to show the current c: Please go to the [$t(strength2)] tab to display the strength, ingredients and skill count corresponding to the current conditions.
translation.the amount under the following condition: We are showing the amount under the following conditions.
translation.use strength tab if you want to change t: If you want to change these conditions, please use the [$t(strength2)] tab.
translation.berry strength: Berry strength (determined by the type of berry and the Pokémon level)
translation.berry count: The amount of Berries per help
translation.bonus factor: Bonus factor (Energy nature factor <nature/> × Subskill factor <subskill/>)
translation.ingredient strength: Ingredient strength (average strength per ingredient help)
translation.ingredient factor: Ingredient factor (determined by the Pokémon level)
translation.skill strength: Skill strength (determined by the type of main skill and skill level)
translation.rp formula: This site is using RP formula elucidated by Goobliss, Harold, Jeancory in the Mathcode server on Discord. For more details about the formula, please read <link/> on Pokémon Sleep Info Wiki.
translation.estimated beyond level: The value beyond level {{level}} is estimated.
translation.ratio is not fixed: The ingredient% and skill% for this Pokémon are not yet confirmed, so provisional values are displayed.
translation.pokemon in the box is edited: The Pokémon in the box have been edited. Please save to apply the changes to the box.
translation.box is full: The box is full. Please delete the unnecessary Pokémon.
translation.box is empty: No Pokémon have been registered yet.
translation.no pokemon found: No Pokémon matching the specified criteria were found.
translation.export message1: The Pokémon information in the box is saved in the browser and will not be transferred to another environment.
translation.export message2: To transfer the Pokémon in the box to another environment, please import the following data into the target environment.
translation.export notice: It is recommended to periodically export the Pokémon data in the box.
translation.import message: Paste the exported data and press the [Import] button.
translation.delete all message: Are you sure you want to delete all the Pokémon in the box?
translation.deleted all pokemon: Deleted all the Pokémon in the box.
translation.initialize all parameters message: Do you want to restore all parameters? Doing so will set the strength to the same value as in the [RP] tab.
translation.recipe bonus help: Please specify the recipe bonus for frequently made meals. Recipe bonuse typically depends on the number of ingredients, but some recipes may have higher bonus values. For details, see the <raenonx>Recipes / Dishes (RaenonX)</raenonx>.
translation.recipe strength help: This value is used to convert ingredients into strength amounts, assuming 80% are used in the recipe and 20% are surplus.
translation.charge energy not implemented: Currently, energy recovery via Charge Energy S is not included in the calculations.
translation.name: Name
translation.strength detail1: You can check the strength, ingredients count, skill trigger count of your Pokémon.
translation.strength detail2: Currently, there are constraints in the calculation logic as follows:
translation.strength restriction2: Energy recovery via Charge Energy S is not included in the calculations.

strength skill info.Ingredient Magnet S: Displays the number of ingredients obtained. This value is not counted towards the total strength amount.
strength skill info.Charge Energy S: Displays the total amount of energy restored. This value is not counted towards the total strength amount. To estimate the impact on the strength amount, change the value of [$t(energy)].
strength skill info.Charge Strength S: Displays the amount of strength you can obtain.
strength skill info.Dream Shard Magnet S: Displays the amount of dream shard you can obtain
strength skill info.Energizing Cheer S: Displays the total amount of energy restored. This value is not counted towards the total strength amount.
strength skill info.Metronome: Displays the number of skill count since it's difficult to estimate the effect. This value is not counted towards the total strength amount.
strength skill info.Energy for Everyone S: Displays the amount restored per Pokémon. To estimate the impact on the strength amount, change the value of [$t(energy)].
strength skill info.Energy for Everyone S (Lunar Blessing):
$t(strength skill info.Energy for Everyone S)
It is assumed that there are 2 Pokémon of the same type. The impact on the strength amount is estimated at 100 per usual help (without area bonuses).
strength skill info.Extra Helpful S: Displays the number of usual help you get by the skill. The impact on the total strength amount is estimated at 300 per usual help (without area bonuses).
strength skill info.Cooking Power-Up S: Displays the pot room you get. The effect of skills is not counted towards the total strength amount.
strength skill info.Helper Boost: Displays the number of usual help per Pokémon (when there are 3 Pokémon of the same type). The impact on the strength amount is estimated at 100 per usual help (without area bonuses).
strength skill info.Berry Burst (Disguise): It is assumed that a great success will not occur. $t(strength skill info.Berry Burst)
strength skill info.Berry Burst: Other Pokémon are estimated to gain 100 strength per berry (without area bonuses).
strength skill info.Tasty Chance S: Displays the Extra Tasty rate increase. The effect of skills is not counted towards the total strength amount.
strength skill info.Skill Copy: Displays the number of skill count since it's difficult to estimate the effect. This value is not counted towards the total strength amount.
strength skill info.Ingredient Draw S (Super Luck): Displays the number of ingredients obtained. This value is not counted towards the total strength amount.
strength skill info.Ingredient Draw S (Hyper Cutter): Displays the number of ingredients obtained. Ingredients acquired additionally are not considered. This value is not counted towards the total strength amount.
strength skill info.not triggered: The main skill is not triggered in this setting.
strength skill info.unknown: The main skill has not been determined yet.

translation.rating detail1: We evaluate subskill and nature tendencies on a scale of 0 to 100 points. For example, in the case of 'berries', the subskill or nature that picks up the most berries are treated as 100 points. We calculate the score based on how much the amount of 'berries' your Pokémon picks up is compared to 100 points.
translation.rating detail2: For Pokémon specialized in berries, it's desirable for their berry score to be high, and for Pokémon specialized in skills, it's desirable for their skill score to be high. Please understand that this is a simple scoring system because we do not consider the following information for the evaluation: Pokémon species, ingredients, skill levels, certain subskills (bonus or inventory), and certain natures (EXP gains or energy recovery).
translation.about1: This tool is an unofficial tool developed by <profile>nitoyon</profile>.
translation.about2: If you have bug reports or improvement suggestions, please contact X (twitter) <x>@nitoyon1</x> or <github>GitHub repository</github>.
translation.about3: I am referring to the data from '<wiki>ポケモンスリープ攻略・検証Wiki</wiki>' and '<rp>RP collection project</rp>'.
translation.about4: The ingredient icon was created by ちゃんりわ.
